title: Scalar variable's .data attribute returns a non-scalar
body_html:
• OS: Mac OSX
  • PyTorch version: master
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Python version: 2.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: CPU version
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): clang

When we access the .data attribute of a scalar variable, the returned tensor is up-cast to have dimension 1. Is this expected?

>>> from torch.autograd import variable
>>> variable(1)
Variable containing:
 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size ()]

>>> variable(1).data
 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

cc. @gchanan

body:
- OS: Mac OSX
- PyTorch version: master
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Python version: 2.7
- CUDA/cuDNN version: CPU version
- GCC version (if compiling from source): clang

When we access the `.data` attribute of a scalar variable, the returned tensor is up-cast to have dimension 1. Is this expected?

```
>>> from torch.autograd import variable
>>> variable(1)
Variable containing:
 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size ()]

>>> variable(1).data
 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
```

cc. @gchanan
